Title: Cross River generated ₦55.5b, spent ₦33.46b in Q1 2025 – Official
Summary: Cross River generated ₦55.5b, spent ₨33.46b in Q1 2025 – official . Capital expenditure accounted for 35% of total spending .

Title: Akwa Ibom governor formally defects to APC
Summary: Governor Umo Eno of Akwa Ibom State has officially defected from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to the All Progressives Congress (APC) The defection was confirmed at a media-restricted event held in Nigeria .

Title: Eid-el-Kabir: CAN felicitates with Muslims, condoles Niger over Mokwa floods
Summary: As Muslims across the country celebrate Eid-el-Kabir, the President of the Christian Association of Nigeria, Archbishop Daniel Okoh has called on Nigerians to embrace peace, unity, and mutual respect . In a statement issued, CAN felicitates with Muslims, condoles Niger over Mokwa floods .

Title: Firms launch AI tech training, donate lab equipment to Bauchi schools
Summary: Firms launch AI tech training, donate lab equipment to Bauchi schools . TechWomen, in partnership with PanAfricare, has launched Artificial Intelligence technology to serve the North East region .

Title: Dead premature baby found inside gutter in Port Harcourt
Summary: A dead premature baby was discovered in a roadside drainage along Ogbuagu Street, Mile 3 Diobu, Port Harcourt, on Wednesday morning .

Title: Justice Uwais, towering figure in Nigeria’s judicial history – CJN
Summary: Justice Uwais was the second-longest-serving CJN in the history of the country . He died in Abuja on Friday .

Title: 7 things you didn’t know about MKO Abiola and the 1993 election
Summary: MKO Abiola was posthumously awarded the Grand Commander of the Federal Republic (GCFR), Nigeria’s highest national honour .

Title: Tottenham sack Postecoglou despite Europa League triumph
Summary: Tottenham Hotspur have announced the departure of Head Coach Ange Postecoglou despite his recent Europa League win with the side . Tottenham have won the Europa League with the Greek side .

Title: Defection: You’ve our fullest cooperation, accommodation, APC assures A’Ibom Gov Eno
Summary: "We are confident that his thoughtful decision will inure to the greater progress of Akwa Ibom state and people," says Eno . APC assures A’Ibom Gov Eno the fullest cooperation, accommodation, assures APC .

Title: Commissioner resigns after Akwa Ibom gov’s defection to APC
Summary: Ememobong acknowledged both Governor Eno and his predecessor, Udom Emmanuel, for their support throughout his public service career . The commissioner said he was grateful for the support of both the Akwa Ibom governor and the predecessor .

Title: Address cause of Niger flooding, group urges FG
Summary: A non-governmental organisation, Christian Conscience, has urged the Federal Government to address the root cause of flooding rather than the palliative measures taken each time there is a disaster . In a statement made available by the group’s publicity secretary, Mr Tunji Oguntuase, on Friday, the group described the recent flood

Title: Supreme Court mourns ex-CJN Uwais
Summary: The late former Chief Justice of Nigeria, Justice Mohammad Uwais, passed away in the early hours of Friday, June 6, 2025, as confirmed by the Director of Information and Public Relations of the Supreme Court of Nigeria . He was the CJN from 1995 until his retirement in 2006, leaving behind a formidable legacy of judicial excellence and

Title: Akwa Ibom gov empowers 540 constituents with N250m
Summary: Governor Umo Eno of Akwa Ibom State has disbursed N250 million to empower over 540 individuals in the Ikot Abasi Federal Constituency through various trade, agriculture, equipment support schemes, and micro, small, and medium enterprises . The Governor made this announcement during a Town-Square Meeting held with the people

Title: NAHCON commences 2025 Hajj return flights June 9
Summary: The National Hajj Commission of Nigeria has scheduled June 9 for the commencement of return flights for Nigerian pilgrims who participated in the 2025 Hajj . The Chairman/CEO of NAHCON, Prof. Abdullahi Saleh, announced this in a statement issued in Minna on Friday .

Title: Ebonyi recorded 590 criminal cases, 897 civil matters in two years
Summary: The Attorney-General and Commissioner for Justice, Mr Ben Odoh, disclosed this during an interactive session with newsmen in Abakaliki . He said that the present administration had successfully made 26 new laws for the interest of peace and justice in the state . Odoh said the state government had created a conducive atmosphere for the justice delivery
